programme.title: The Huntsman: Winter's War, (2016, Fantasy)
programme.desc: A huntsman (Chris Hemsworth) and a fellow warrior (Jessica Chastain) battle an ice queen (Emily Blunt) and her evil, resurrected sister (Charlize Theron).

programme.title: Mechanic: Resurrection, (2016, Action)
programme.desc: Bishop's most formidable foe kidnaps the love of his life in order to make him complete three impossible assassinations and make them look like accidents.

programme.title: For All Mankind, (1989, Documentary)
programme.desc: A unique view of the moon is made possible through film taken by the Apollo astronauts who landed on the surface.

programme.title: Tiny Furniture, (2010, Comedy)
programme.desc: After breaking up with her boyfriend, a recent college graduate (Lena Dunham) moves back in with family while she tries to figure out the next step in life.

programme.title: Water for Elephants, (2011, Drama)
programme.desc: A shared compassion for a special elephant draws together a former veterinary student (Robert Pattinson) and a performer (Reese Witherspoon) in the traveling circus in which they both work.

programme.title: User Zero, (2024, Drama)
programme.desc: A passionate neuroscientist must save her patients from her own invention before losing her mind.

programme.title: Twin Peaks: Fire Walk With Me, (1992, Crime Story)
programme.desc: Agent Cooper (Kyle MacLachlan) comes to Twin Peaks, Wash., following two unresolved murders and the disappearance of two fellow agents.

programme.title: Pens & Pencils, (2022, Thriller)
programme.desc: A high school teacher embarks on a wild-goose chase to find a missing student that no one else seems to miss.

programme.title: Addicted, (2014, Drama)
programme.desc: A successful businesswoman (Sharon Leal) puts her family, career and life on the line to satisfy her addiction to sex.

programme.title: Warcraft, (2016, Fantasy)
programme.desc: A king (Dominic Cooper), a mighty warrior (Travis Fimmel) and a powerful wizard (Ben Foster) unite to defend the human realm of Azeroth from a tyrannical shaman (Daniel Wu) and his invading army of orcs.

programme.title: 3 Days to Kill, (2014, Action)
programme.desc: A dying Secret Service agent (Kevin Costner) who wants to reconnect with his estranged daughter (Hailee Steinfeld) is offered a potentially lifesaving drug in exchange for completing one final mission.

programme.title: Shame, (2011, Drama)
programme.desc: The arrival of his needy sister (Carey Mulligan) forces a man (Michael Fassbender) to confront his sex addiction out in the open.

programme.title: Free Fire, (2016, Action)
programme.desc: When a black-market arms deal goes outrageously wrong, Justine finds herself caught in the crossfire, forced to navigate through a warehouse full of trigger-happy madmen who are all hanging on for dear life.

programme.title: Ghosts of Girlfriends Past, (2009, Romance)
programme.desc: Spirits of jilted lovers take a photographer (Matthew McConaughey) on an odyssey through his many failed relationships to find out what made him such a cad, and if there is any hope for true love.

programme.title: Almost Christmas, (2016, Christmas)
programme.desc: A beloved patriarch asks his family members for one gift this holiday season: to get along. If they can honor that wish and spend five days under the same roof without killing one another, it will be a Christmas miracle.

programme.title: We Are Your Friends, (2015, Drama)
programme.desc: An aspiring disc jockey (Zac Efron) befriends a veteran DJ (Wes Bentley) who shows him the ropes, but jeopardizes it all when he falls for the man's young girlfriend (Emily Ratajkowski).

programme.title: We Are Your Friends, (2015, Drama)
programme.desc: An aspiring disc jockey (Zac Efron) befriends a veteran DJ (Wes Bentley) who shows him the ropes, but jeopardizes it all when he falls for the man's young girlfriend (Emily Ratajkowski).

programme.title: Gone With the Wind, (1939, Romance)
programme.desc: Presented as originally released in 1939. Includes themes and character depictions which may be offensive and problematic to contemporary audiences. A Southern belle struggles to return her family's estate to its original glory after the Civil War.

programme.title: Spaceship Earth, (2020, Documentary)
programme.desc: In 1991 eight visionaries embark on a two-year experiment to quarantine themselves inside Biosphere 2 -- a self-engineered replica of Earth's ecosystem.

programme.title: Eye in the Sky, (2015, Thriller)
programme.desc: A lieutenant general (Alan Rickman) and a colonel (Helen Mirren) face political opposition after ordering a drone missile strike to take out a group of suicide bombers in Nairobi, Kenya.

programme.title: Scream 2, (1997, Horror)
programme.desc: A masked killer continues to pursue a California student (Neve Campbell) and her friends at an Ohio college.

programme.title: Black Adam, (2022, Action)
programme.desc: Bestowed with the almighty powers of the gods, Black Adam's unique form of justice, born out of rage, is challenged by modern-day heroes who form the Justice Society: Hawkman, Dr. Fate, Atom Smasher and Cyclone.

programme.title: St. Vincent, (2014, Comedy)
programme.desc: An unlikely bond forms between a single woman's 12-year-old son (Jaeden Lieberher) and the boozy misanthrope (Bill Murray) who lives next door.

programme.title: Godzilla vs. Mechagodzilla, (1974, Science fiction)
programme.desc: An Okinawan monster-god helps Godzilla defeat his bionic double.

programme.title: Vampires Suck, (2010, Comedy)
programme.desc: In a spoof of "Twilight" and other films, a pale vampire and a muscular werewolf try to win the heart of a beautiful teen.

programme.title: Jonah Hex, (2010, Action)
programme.desc: Jonah Hex has one foot in the natural world and one in the supernatural. His unusual nature gives him the ability to track down anyone, so the Army makes him an offer. It will erase the warrants on his head if he finds Quentin Turnbull.

programme.title: The Devil's Rejects, (2005, Horror)
programme.desc: A vengeful sheriff and two bounty hunters track a murderous family (Sid Haig, Bill Moseley, Sheri Moon Zombie) on the run.

programme.title: A United Kingdom, (2016, History)
programme.desc: In the 1940s, Prince Seretse Khama of Botswana shocks the world when he marries a white woman from London.

programme.title: X-Men: Apocalypse, (2016, Action)
programme.desc: Professor X (James McAvoy) and Raven (Jennifer Lawrence) lead a team of young X-Men to stop the immortal mutant Apocalypse (Oscar Isaac) from destroying mankind.

programme.title: X-Men: Apocalypse, (2016, Action)
programme.desc: Professor X (James McAvoy) and Raven (Jennifer Lawrence) lead a team of young X-Men to stop the immortal mutant Apocalypse (Oscar Isaac) from destroying mankind.

programme.title: It Follows, (2014, Horror)
programme.desc: Following a strange sexual encounter, a teenager (Maika Monroe) has disturbing visions and the inescapable feeling that someone -- or something -- is stalking her.

programme.title: Nine Lives, (2016, Comedy)
programme.desc: A workaholic billionaire (Kevin Spacey) tries to communicate with his family when a bizarre turn of events traps him inside the body of a cat named Mr. Fuzzypants.

programme.title: Sherlock Holmes, (2009, Action)
programme.desc: The resourceful detective (Robert Downey Jr.) and his astute partner, Dr. Watson (Jude Law), meet a powerful criminal, a devotee of black magic who arises from his grave.

programme.title: Almost Christmas, (2016, Christmas)
programme.desc: A beloved patriarch asks his family members for one gift this holiday season: to get along. If they can honor that wish and spend five days under the same roof without killing one another, it will be a Christmas miracle.

programme.title: The Killing of a Sacred Deer, (2017, Thriller)
programme.desc: A fatherless teen starts to insinuate himself into the life of a renowned surgeon, his wife and two children. The full scope of his intent soon becomes menacingly clear when he confronts the doctor with a long-forgotten transgression.

programme.title: Black Adam, (2022, Action)
programme.desc: Bestowed with the almighty powers of the gods, Black Adam's unique form of justice, born out of rage, is challenged by modern-day heroes who form the Justice Society: Hawkman, Dr. Fate, Atom Smasher and Cyclone.

programme.title: Teen Spirit, (2018, Drama)
programme.desc: A shy teenager dreams of escaping her small town and pursuing her passion to sing. With the help of an unlikely mentor, she enters a local singing competition that will test her integrity, talent and ambition.

programme.title: Absolutely Fabulous: The Movie, (2016, Comedy)
programme.desc: London publicist Edina Monsoon and best friend Patsy Stone flee to the French Riviera after accidentally knocking supermodel Kate Moss into the River Thames.

programme.title: The Lighthouse, (2019, Thriller)
programme.desc: Two lighthouse keepers try to maintain their sanity while living on a remote and mysterious New England island in the 1890s.

programme.title: Blood Father, (2016, Action)
programme.desc: An ex-convict (Mel Gibson) and his estranged daughter (Erin Moriarty) go on the run from her drug-dealing boyfriend (Diego Luna) and his vicious cartel.

programme.title: Anthropoid, (2016, History)
programme.desc: In December 1941, two Czech soldiers (Cillian Murphy, Jamie Dornan) parachute into their occupied homeland to assassinate Nazi officer Reinhard Heydrich (Detlef Bothe).

programme.title: American Ultra, (2015, Action)
programme.desc: When his secret past comes back to haunt him, a small-town stoner (Jesse Eisenberg) must use his latent, deadly skills to prevent the CIA from taking him out.

programme.title: It Comes at Night, (2017, Horror)
programme.desc: After a mysterious apocalypse leaves the world with few survivors, two families are forced to share a home in an uneasy alliance to keep the outside evil at bay -- only to learn that the true horror may come from within.

programme.title: Everything, Everything, (2017, Romance)
programme.desc: Confined to her house due to an illness, a smart and imaginative 18-year-old (Amandla Stenberg) develops a budding romance with the teen (Nick Robinson) who lives next door.

programme.title: Everything, Everything, (2017, Romance)
programme.desc: Confined to her house due to an illness, a smart and imaginative 18-year-old (Amandla Stenberg) develops a budding romance with the teen (Nick Robinson) who lives next door.

programme.title: Home Again, (2017, Romance)
programme.desc: Separated from her husband, Alice lets three young men -- Harry, George and Teddy -- stay in her guesthouse. As Alice develops a budding romance with Harry, her newfound happiness comes crashing down when her ex shows up with a suitcase in his hand.

programme.title: Superman: Unbound, (2013, Animated)
programme.desc: Superman (Matt Bomer) battles Brainiac (John Noble) to save the Krypton city of Kandor, which is miniaturized and held aboard Brainiac's ship.

programme.title: A Bigger Splash, (2015, Thriller)
programme.desc: While vacationing on a Sicilian island with her boyfriend (Matthias Schoenaerts), a rock star (Tilda Swinton) receives an unexpected visit from an old flame (Ralph Fiennes) and his seductive daughter (Dakota Johnson).

programme.title: Scream 3, (2000, Horror)
programme.desc: Murders draw a young woman (Neve Campbell), a reporter (Courteney Cox Arquette) and an ex-policeman (David Arquette) to the set of a movie inspired by horrific events that they survived.

programme.title: Knight and Day, (2010, Action)
programme.desc: A woman (Cameron Diaz) gets ensnared in a deadly, global adventure when she becomes the reluctant partner of a fugitive spy (Tom Cruise).

programme.title: Balls Out, (2014, Comedy)
programme.desc: Fifth year college senior Caleb Fuller (Jake Lacy) gets his flag football team back together for one last shot at intramural football glory.

programme.title: Birds of Prey (and the Fantabulous Emancipation of One Harley Quinn), (2020, Action)
programme.desc: Harley Quinn faces the wrath of narcissistic crime boss Black Mask and every other thug in Gotham. But things soon even out for Harley when she becomes unexpected allies with three deadly women -- Huntress, Black Canary and Renee Montoya.

programme.title: Batman and Superman: Battle of the Super Sons, (2022, Animated)
programme.desc: On his birthday, Jonathan Kent learns his dad is Superman and that he has superpowers of his own. He also meets Damian Wayne. The two boys are forced to team up to protect their loved ones from a hostile alien force.

programme.title: The Ballad of Lefty Brown, (2017, Western)
programme.desc: A merciless cowboy sets out on a dangerous journey across the frontier, determined to do whatever it takes to avenge his longtime partner's brutal murder.

programme.title: The 9th Life of Louis Drax, (2016, Thriller)
programme.desc: An acclaimed neurologist (Jamie Dornan) taps into the unconscious mind of a 9-year-old boy (Aiden Longworth) who has survived nine near-death accidents.

programme.title: Good Time, (2017, Thriller)
programme.desc: A bank robber stops at nothing to free his brother from prison, launching himself into a nightlong odyssey through New York's dark and dangerous criminal underworld.

programme.title: Skin, (2019, Documentary)
programme.desc: Nollywood actress Beverly Naya explores Black beauty and the practice of skin bleaching in African culture.

programme.title: Sergio Leone: The Italian Who Invented America, (2022, Documentary)
programme.desc: An homage to Italian film director Sergio Leone, credited as the pioneer of the spaghetti western subgenre, featuring interviews with Quentin Tarantino, Robert De Niro and Clint Eastwood.

programme.title: Dances With Wolves, (1990, History)
programme.desc: Costner's epic vision of the American frontier as seen through the eyes of a 19th-century U.S. Cavalry officer.

programme.title: Unhuman, (2022, Horror)
programme.desc: Seven misfit students must band together against a growing gang of unhuman savages. Their trust in each other gets tested to the limit in a brutal, horrifying fight to survive as they take down the murderous zombie creatures.

programme.title: K2, (1992, Adventure)
programme.desc: A playboy Seattle lawyer (Michael Biehn) and a family-man professor (Matt Craven) join an expedition climbing the Himalayan peak.

programme.title: Cop Land, (1997, Thriller)
programme.desc: The sheriff (Sylvester Stallone) of a small New Jersey police community confronts key men (Harvey Keitel, Ray Liotta) on both sides of a law-enforcement cover-up.

programme.title: Walking Tall, (2004, Action)
programme.desc: When Chris Vaughn returns to his hometown to find work, he finds that the lumber mill has closed and the town's big business is now a casino. Aided by his friend Ray Templeton, Vaughn tries to make a stand against the area's crime and corruption.

programme.title: The Core, (2003, Action)
programme.desc: In order to save mankind, scientists and astronauts must set off a nuclear device at the center of the Earth.

programme.title: Transformers: Rise of the Beasts, (2023, Action)
programme.desc: Optimus Prime and the Autobots take on their biggest challenge yet. When a new threat capable of destroying the entire planet emerges, they must team up with a powerful faction of Transformers known as the Maximals to save Earth.

programme.title: Emperor of Ocean Park
programme.desc: After discovering that their older brother is responsible for hiding a valuable piece of information, Tal and Mariah track down a reluctant Addison for answers.

programme.title: Emperor of Ocean Park
programme.desc: Following the tragic events in 2003, The Judge looks to Jack Ziegler to exact a plan of revenge.

programme.title: Looper, (2012, Science fiction)
programme.desc: A mob hit man (Joseph Gordon-Levitt) comes to the chilling realization that his latest assignment is his older self (Bruce Willis), sent back in time by his bosses.

programme.title: xXx: Return of Xander Cage, (2017, Action)
programme.desc: Daredevil operative Xander Cage (Vin Diesel) springs into action when four dangerous criminals steal Pandora's Box, a device that controls every military satellite in the world.

programme.title: Rings, (2017, Horror)
programme.desc: A young woman (Matilda Lutz) makes a horrifying discovery after her boyfriend (Alex Roe) investigates a story about a mysterious video that kills people seven days after they watch it.

programme.title: Battle of Britain, (1969, War)
programme.desc: With London facing almost certain annihilation, British fighter pilots defend their skies against Germany's Luftwaffe.

programme.title: Rain Man, (1988, Drama)
programme.desc: A wheeler-dealer (Tom Cruise) meets his brother (Dustin Hoffman), an institutionalized autistic-savant, heir to $3 million.

programme.title: Rain Man, (1988, Drama)
programme.desc: A wheeler-dealer (Tom Cruise) meets his brother (Dustin Hoffman), an institutionalized autistic-savant, heir to $3 million.

programme.title: Heaven's Gate, (1980, Western)
programme.desc: A well-educated marshal defends immigrant settlers against cattle barons in 1890s Johnson County, Wyoming.

programme.title: Rob Roy, (1995, Drama)
programme.desc: The Scottish folk hero (Liam Neeson) fights for clan and honor, hunted by vile aristocrats in the 1700s.

programme.title: The Time Machine, (2002, Science fiction)
programme.desc: A scientist (Guy Pearce) travels into the future and meets a race of people who fear hideous monsters living under the ground.

programme.title: The Golden Child, (1986, Comedy)
programme.desc: A professional child-finder (Eddie Murphy) is recruited to rescue a mystical Tibetan boy from a shape-shifting villain (Charles Dance).

programme.title: Three Thousand Years of Longing, (2022, Fantasy)
programme.desc: While attending a conference in Istanbul, Dr. Alithea Binnie happens to encounter a djinn who offers her three wishes in exchange for his freedom. Eventually, she's beguiled and makes a wish that surprises them both.

programme.title: Star Trek II: The Wrath of Khan, (1982, Science fiction)
programme.desc: Kirk (William Shatner), Spock (Leonard Nimoy) and the Enterprise crew battle an old foe (Ricardo Montalban) who blames Kirk for the death of his wife.

programme.title: Apollo 13, (1995, History)
programme.desc: Astronauts Jim Lovell, Fred Haise and Jack Swigert try to return to Earth after an explosion aborts the April 1970 moonshot.

programme.title: The Aviator, (2004, History)
programme.desc: During the 1930s and '40s, wealthy industrialist Howard Hughes (Leonardo DiCaprio) gains fame as a movie producer, airplane designer and pilot.

programme.title: Into the Wild, (2007, Drama)
programme.desc: A top student and athlete leaves his middle-class life to venture into Alaska, only to meet people who will eventually shape his values and life.

programme.title: Godfather of Harlem
programme.desc: An attack on Bumpy's family forces him to team up with unlikely allies to retaliate against Joe Colombo; Margaret stays with Elise and the Panthers and helps Jerome; Pino betrays Stella; Colombo plans a Civil Rights rally in Central Park.

programme.title: The Great Raid, (2005, War)
programme.desc: In 1944 Lt. Col. Henry Mucci (Benjamin Bratt) leads a U.S. battalion to rescue more than 500 prisoners of war from a Japanese camp.

programme.title: The Great Raid, (2005, War)
programme.desc: In 1944 Lt. Col. Henry Mucci (Benjamin Bratt) leads a U.S. battalion to rescue more than 500 prisoners of war from a Japanese camp.

programme.title: The Portable Door, (2023, Fantasy)
programme.desc: A man lands an internship at a mysterious London firm with unconventional employees, including the charismatic CEO who is incorporating modern corporate strategy into ancient magical practices.

programme.title: The Deep House, (2021, Horror)
programme.desc: While diving in a remote French lake, two YouTubers who specialize in underwater exploration videos discover a house submerged in deep waters. Their dive turns into a nightmare when they discover the house was the scene of atrocious crimes.

programme.title: The Indian in the Cupboard, (1995, Fantasy)
programme.desc: A magic cabinet brings to life a 9-year-old's (Hal Scardino) action figures, including a 3-inch-high Indian named Little Bear (Litefoot).

programme.title: Doubt, (2008, Drama)
programme.desc: Suspicions of child abuse fuel a traditionalist nun's (Meryl Streep) personal crusade against a popular priest (Philip Seymour Hoffman) who wants to reform her school's strict customs.

programme.title: Footloose, (2011, Musical)
programme.desc: A rebellious teen (Kenny Wormald) incurs the wrath of a much-loved clergyman (Dennis Quaid) by challenging the town's ban on loud music and dancing.

programme.title: An Officer and a Gentleman, (1982, Drama)
programme.desc: A hardened loner (Richard Gere) shapes up for a military drill instructor (Louis Gossett Jr.) and a factory girl (Debra Winger) from town.

programme.title: The Natural, (1984, Drama)
programme.desc: The almost mythical ability of a middle-aged baseball player rockets a major-league team toward the 1939 pennant.

programme.title: Good Will Hunting, (1997, Drama)

programme.title: Repercussions of Doflamingo's defeat reverberate around the world! Fujitora's actions put the Navy in a tight spot, and the "Worst Generation" beings to stir into action!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Sending a Shock Wave! The Worst Generation Goes Into Action!

programme.title: The combatants in the battle for Dressrosa can finally begin to recoup, but those who stay awake are treated to the story of how Sabo joined the Revolutionary Army!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: The Birth of the Legend! The Adventures of the Revolutionary Warrior Sabo!

programme.title: Sabo recounts his surprising reunion with Luffy at the Colosseum as the Straw Hats and the others continue to recoup. Meanwhile, Fujitora gambles on how to make his next move - and the odds are in Luffy's favor!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: The Brothers' Bond! The Untold Story Behind Luffy and Sabo's Reunion!

programme.title: As Sabo departs, our attention shifts to the other Straw Hats waging a fierce battle on a mysterious island. And a new drama is set into motion as ill portents fall from the sky!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: The Strongest Creature! One of the Four Emperors - Kaido, King of the Beasts!

programme.title: As Luffy and the others begin to come to their senses, major players in the Navy arrive to search Dressrosa for the Straw Hats! Also, Rebecca's history is whitewashed with a fake cover story - but why?
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Fujitora Takes Action! The Complete Siege of the Straw Hats!

programme.title: Fujitora's flirting with chance has turned out poorly for the Straw Hats as the full Navy force bears down on Dressrosa searching for the pirates! Luffy and the others make a mad dash for the east port to get off the island.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: A State of Emergency! Rebecca Is Kidnapped!

programme.title: Rebecca has precious little time to follow Luffy's lead and make it to Kyros. Can she make it in time? Meanwhile, Fujitora is closing in on Bartolomeo and the other Colosseum warriors while Trafalgar Law faces the shadows of his past!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: The Bond Between Father and Daughter! Kyros and Rebecca!

programme.title: Law and Sengoku share memories of Corazon, and the secret of Trafalgar Law's name. Meanwhile, Fujitora uses the destruction caused by the battle in Dressrosa as a weapon, and squares off one-on-one with Luffy!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Men's Pride! Luffy vs. Fujitora, Head-to-Head!

programme.title: The people of Dressrosa show their appreciation to the Straw Hats one last time by foiling Fujitora's strategy. As Luffy and the others are able to finally make their break from the island, however, an unbelievable new chapter opens in the story.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: No Way Out! Admiral Fujitora's Ruthless Pursuit!

programme.title: With newfound allies won in the battle at Dressrosa, and as the Navy watches, Luffy and the Straw Hats depart Dressrosa for open water. But will Luffy accept the oath of allegiance given by his new fleet?
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Sons' Cups! The Straw Hat Fleet is Formed!

programme.title: While the Straw Hats are underway, Doflamingo has serious predictions for the upset of the world order! Meanwhile, the recent actions in Dressrosa have led to surprising results!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: The Numerous Rivals Struggle Amongst Themselves! The Raging Monsters of the New World

programme.title: While heading to the next island, Zou, Luffy's appetite causes them trouble and he and Bartolomeo find themselves entangled in the scheme of a pirate lord who can manipulate silver.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: The Silver Fortress! Luffy and Barto's Great Adventure!

programme.title: The Tram-Man arrives! And has Luffy, Bartolomeo and Desire on the run! The deeper the three fall into the pit, however, the more clear it becomes that Bill's group hides a terrible secret!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: An Underground Maze! Luffy vs. the Tram Human!

programme.title: Luffy, Bartolomeo, and Desire make their way up the mineshaft, but Bill's assassin, Peseta, has other plans! Just when the going gets tough, help arrives, and Zoro battles the assassin head on!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: The Sword Technique Heats Up! Law and Zoro Finally Appear!

programme.title: Luffy, Desire, and Bartolomeo go up against Bill! But the mad, Smelt-Smelt man becomes deranged and lets his true power unfurl! Do Luffy and the others have any hope of exposing Bill's self-serving aims and turning his gang against him?
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: A Desperate Situation! Luffy Fights a Battle in Extreme Heat!

programme.title: Bartolomeo recounts the formation of the Straw Hats, sharing their moving story with the rest of his crew! Meanwhile, the mysterious island of Zou approaches in the distance, obscured by fog. But when the haze clears, no one is expecting what they see!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Curtain-up on a New Adventure! Arriving at the Phantom Island, Zou!

programme.title: Luffy and the others arrive at the mysterious land of Zou, and find the Sunny. But when they board, they find the other Straw Hats have already disembarked. Thus, Luffy, Zoro, Robin and the others take on the challenge of climbing the monstrous elephant!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: The New Warlord! The Legendary Whitebeard's Son Appears!

programme.title: Finally scaling the elephant's back, the Straw Hats continue their search for the other half of their crew! But the mysterious "island" on the back of the elephant may hold more danger than they bargained for, as they learn they are not alone!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: A Deadly Elephant Climb! A Great Adventure on the Back of the Giant Elephant!

programme.title: Luffy pushes deeper into the mysterious forest on the elephant's back, but he's treading in territory where is not welcome! Meanwhile, Usopp and the others make a startling discovery in a ruined city!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: A Battle Begins! Luffy vs. the Mink Tribe!

programme.title: Luffy and the others survive the Rain-Ruption and learn of its vital role in maintaining life on Zou.
programme.desc: One Piece

programme.title: Luffy and the others are unexpectedly welcomed at the fortress and treated well by the Minks, although they have to navigate some cultural differences‚Ä¶ And Nami starts sharing what happened to them after they left Dressrosa.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Start to Counterattack! Great Moves by the Twirly Hat Crew!

programme.title: Luffy and the others learn about the dangerous intruders who have come to Zou, and why the island is wrecked! Afterwards, Luffy's loose lips get them into trouble!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: A Threat Descends! The Beast Pirates, Jack!

programme.title: Duke Dogstorm - the Straw Hats finally meet the ruler of this strange land, and learn more about the battle that took place here; and the mysterious system by which the island is ruled!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: The King of the Day! Duke Dogstorm Appears!

programme.title: Day turns to night as the Minks keep up their onslaught against the invading Beast Pirates! But Jack's amazing Devil Fruit power may end the elephant island once and for all!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: The King of the Night! Master Cat Viper Emerges!

programme.title: Night and day, Jack faces the fury of the two sworn defenders of Zou, but while they put up a good fight, the Minks aren't able to subdue Jack, especially after he brings out his secret weapon.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: The Exterminated Capital! The Twirly Hat Crew Arrive!

programme.title: In the aftermath of Jack's deadly attack on the island of Zou, Chopper and Sanji rush in to save the fallen Mink Tribe - but they will need the help of Caesar to overcome the poisonous effects of the gas!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: The Time Limit Closes in! The Bond Between the Mink Tribe and the Crew!

programme.title: More of the dramatic happenings on Zou are revealed as we learn that Jack's pirate band were not the only visitors to the elephant island! And what about the mysterious fate of Sanji?
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: The Delinquent Comes Home! Emperor Big Mom's Assassins!

programme.title: The mystery of Sanji's disappearance deepens as Luffy learns that Big Mom's lackeys have caught up with him and the rest - and carry with them an invitation from Big Mom that simply can't be refused!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: The Truth Behind the Disappearance! Sanji Gets a Startling Invitation!

programme.title: Sanji's dire situation has become clear, but instead of rallying against Big Mom's crew, he submits to go along with them to bring an end to this situation. But being separated from one of his crew is more than Luffy is willing to tolerate!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: To My Buds! Sanji's Farewell Note!

programme.title: There's only one key to finding out what happened to Sanji - and Luffy and the others make their way towards finding out more about their friend's disappearance, but on their way the indigenous fauna give them trouble!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Let's Go and Meet Master Cat Viper!

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd TVSP #15: Operation: Return the Treasure
programme.desc: Lupin sets his sights on the legendary Trick Diamond, stolen by his late rival Mark Williams. Instead of finding the diamond, Fujiko relays Mark's dying challenge: return all the other treasures he stole to reveal the location of the gem.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd TVSP #16: Swallowtail Tatoo
programme.desc: A mysterious criminal captures Lupin and Fujiko with a very specific order: in order to save Fujiko's life, Lupin must infiltrate a high-security museum and steal the Bull's Eye jewel. One little problem: the jewel is cursed to kill anyone who steals it.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: Part 5 + 50th Anniversary Special
programme.desc: Lupin's new target is the digital currency gained from the transactions made on this site. Lupin sneaks into a massive high-security server facility, known as the "twin towers". Lupin greets the guard to the key, a young girl and skilled hacker "Ami".
programme.sub-title: The Girl in the Twin Towers

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: Part 5 + 50th Anniversary Special
programme.desc: "Hunt down the greatest thief of our times, Lupin III!" The Marco Polo executives have set a trap in the form of the Lupin Game. This has people all over the world tracking down Lupin.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: Part 5 + 50th Anniversary Special
programme.desc: Shinpei Mayama, the Rat Clan, Union Mama... the all-stars of assassination, from all over the world, suddenly come after Lupin. They're players in a new game started by the executives of Marco Polo: Happy Deathday.
programme.sub-title: The Killers Gather in the Wasteland

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: Part 5 + 50th Anniversary Special
programme.desc: Fujiko smiles deviously as she points her gun at Lupin, when Zenigata arrives to save him and Ami. They get into the inspector's car which takes off, but it's soon attacked by soldiers who are trying to cash in the price on Lupin's head.
programme.sub-title: Zenigata's Pride and the Desert Dust

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: Part 5 + 50th Anniversary Special
programme.desc: Lupin is shot in the head by a drone fighter. With the death of its target, the Lupin Game is concluded. Time passes, and people forget about the game. Released from his duty of hunting Lupin, Ami now lives with Zenigata, when one day Goemon visits her.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: Part 5 + 50th Anniversary Special
programme.desc: The "Smart Safe" has come to the Greater Tokyo Bank. Lupin is goaded by Fujiko and Jigen to try and crack the technological wonder. What can he do against this peculiarly secure safe?

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: Part 5 + 50th Anniversary Special
programme.desc: Lupin is hired by Gaston to retrieve a painting, and manages to do so easily enough... except the painting has a strange resemblance to a real Picasso piece, forcing Lupin to examine the truth behind why he was hired.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: Part 5 + 50th Anniversary Special
programme.desc: Lupin visits Gaston's grave. There he meets the elderly Camille, with who he goes out for a drink when the pub's phone begins to ring. On the other end of the line is the supposedly dead Gaston.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: Part 5 + 50th Anniversary Special
programme.desc: Lupin is shot, and Albert gets his hands on the notebook. Lupin is saved by Jigen and Goemon and manages to survive his injuries under care. He then explains his past with Albert and how they know each other.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: Part 5 + 50th Anniversary Special
programme.desc: After learning the shocking truth about Jose's terrifying plot, Lupin heads to Jose's headquarters with Albert, his old thieving comrade. Jigen and Goemon fight off the heaviest opposition while Lupin and Albert head into the heart of the enemy territory.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: Part 5 + 50th Anniversary Special
programme.desc: To steal the fortune of the Drug King Pablo, the gang heads to South America with Fujiko. As Fujiko distracts the target, Lupin picks off the remains of Pablo's guards while making his way through the jungle.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: Part 5 + 50th Anniversary Special
programme.desc: In a rural town in France, full of cosplayers. Within the town celebrating a pop-cultural event is Goemon. Next to the inn, he decides to keep watch at is Chlo√©'s Bistro. Chlo√© is exactly the woman Goemon was looking for Lupin's current target.
programme.sub-title: The Extravagance of Goemon Ishikawa XIII

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: Part 5 + 50th Anniversary Special
programme.desc: Having enrolled at the Annecy School for Girls, Ami encounters a strange girl in the garden who aims her bow at a crow. The girl is Dolma, the princess of the Kingdom of Padar. Having no friends, Ami finds herself opening up to the odd Dolma.
programme.sub-title: The Bow, The Princess, and the Terrorist

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: Part 5 + 50th Anniversary Special
programme.desc: "Princess Dolma, please save Padar." With that request, Dolma is taken home. Lupin follows shortly, and Ami decides to accompany Fujiko to Padar in order to save Dolma.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: Part 5 + 50th Anniversary Special
programme.desc: Lupin is pierced by Dolma's arrow. Ami and Fujiko take Lupin and escape, hiding in a deserted building. The three of them decide to flee, with Lupin badly injured.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: Part 5 + 50th Anniversary Special
programme.desc: Padar sinks into chaos because of the civil war, but things take a sudden turn when the Shake Hands company gets involved. A proclamation by the king is posted online, proving him to be alive.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: Part 5 + 50th Anniversary Special
programme.desc: "I want you to find out who killed my husband." Three years ago, someone shot Count Maupassant to death.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: Part 5 + 50th Anniversary Special
programme.desc: Shortly after moving into the hideout in Riquewihr, Lupin wakes up to a broken bathroom. After bickering with Jigen for access to the bathroom, Fujiko appears.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: Part 5 + 50th Anniversary Special
programme.desc: A string of indiscriminate shootings has struck Northern Africa. They're actually a challenge to Lupin from the wealthy Zylberstein.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: Part 5 + 50th Anniversary Special
programme.desc: Lupin's gang visits the Northern Angel, on the outskirts of Russia. What at first seems like a snowy, dull town turns out to be full of riches to the joy of the group of thieves.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: Part 5 + 50th Anniversary Special
programme.desc: "Peoplelog"--a social media service that uses AI to analyze the incredible amount of data on the internet, allowing you to learn all about a person.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: Part 5 + 50th Anniversary Special
programme.desc: Fujiko has been captured. She's being held at Orig Island, the headquarters of Shake Hands. Lupin and the gang, including Ami, head there to find her.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: Part 5 + 50th Anniversary Special
programme.desc: "Papa! Save Lupin!" Ami is reunited with her long-last father. But Enzo is already obsessed with using Peoplelog to save the world.
programme.sub-title: Just Then, An Old Buddy Said Something

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: Part 5 + 50th Anniversary Special
programme.desc: Lupin III has vanished from the internet. Meanwhile, the man himself is updating Peoplelog with confidential information that begins to throw the world into chaos.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: Part 5 + 50th Anniversary Special
programme.desc: Lupin receives an invitation to join a race by Mr. X. Jigen and Goemon questions Lupin's willingness to join despite knowing it's a trap, but Lupin has his eyes on the Golden Statue rumored to be in a mansion near the race course.
programme.sub-title: 50th Anniversary Special - Is Lupin Still Burning?

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd TVSP #17: Tactics Of Angels
programme.desc: Lupin faces his toughest opponents yet! Four women known as the Bloody Angels are after the strange metallic sphere he stole from Area 51. To get their hands on potential alien technology, they're willing to do anything.

programme.title: Stealth, (2005, Action)
programme.desc: From the director of XXX and The Fast and The Furious comes an exhilarating epic blockbuster starring Josh Lucas, Jessica Biel and Academy Award¬Æ Winner Jamie Foxx (Best Actor, RAY, 2004). rated -PG-13

programme.title: Gladiator, (2000, Action)
programme.desc: A man robbed of his name and his dignity strives to win them back, and gain the freedom of his people, in this epic historical drama from director Ridley Scott.

programme.title: Gamer, (2009, Action)
programme.desc: Set in a future world where humans can control other humans in mass-scale, multi-player online gaming environments, a star player (Butler) from a game called 'Slayers' looks to regain his independence while taking down the game's mastermind (Hall).

programme.title: First Knight, (1995, Romance)
programme.desc: Together, Sean Connery, Richard Gere, Julia Ormond (Legends of the Fall, Sabrina) and Jerry Zucker, the director of Ghost, bring you a new vision of King Arthur's Camelot.

programme.title: Skyline, (2010, Science fiction)
programme.desc: Jarrod and Elaine travel to Los Angeles to meet his friend Terry and his wife Candice. Terry gives a party in his apartment for Jarrod. The next morning, the group is awakened by beams of light. The group of friends try to escape from the alien invaders.

programme.title: Automata, (2014, Action)
programme.desc: Jacq Vaucan (Antonio Banderas, 'The Mask of Zorro') is an insurance agent of ROC robotics corporation who investigates cases of robots violating their primary protocols against altering themselves.

programme.title: Accident Man, (2018, Action)
programme.desc: Mike is a tough hitman, who makes his hits look like accidents or suicide. He's in a gang of hitmen, each with his own style. When his loved ex is killed, Mike looks for those responsible.

programme.title: Vera Cruz, (1954, Western)
programme.desc: In this epic Western, two shady mercenaries (Gary Cooper, Burt Lancaster) in Mexico during the 1866 revolution are hired to escort a Countess and her gold to the Mexican army in Vera Cruz and find themselves at odds with the army‚Ä¶and each other!

programme.title: High Noon, (1951, Western)
programme.desc: Gary Cooper won the Oscar for the Best Actor in this classic tale of a lawman who stands alone to defend a town of cowardly citizens against a gang of revenge-seeking criminals.

programme.title: Gunfight at the O.K. Corral, (1957, Western)
programme.desc: Frontier lawman Wyatt Earp joins his three brothers in their feud against the villainous Clanton gang, a local clan of cattle thieves in Tombstone, Arizona.

programme.title: The Sons of Katie Elder, (1965, Western)
programme.desc: The four rowdy sons of Katie Elder return home for her funeral and to avenge her death.

programme.title: Big Jake, (1971, Action)
programme.desc: An aging Texas cattle man who has outlived his time swings into action when outlaws kidnap his grandson and wound his son.

programme.title: The Cowboy and the Lady, (1938, Western)
programme.desc: A lonely socialite masquerades as a maid and meets an unpretentious, plain-spoken cowboy who is unaware of her true identity.

programme.title: Kit Carson, (1940, Western)
programme.desc: Indian fighter, trapper, and frontier scout Kit Carson leads a wagon train of settlers from Fort Bridger, along the Oregon Trail through Shoshone territory, to California, which plans to secede from Mexico.

programme.title: The Big Country, (1958, Western)
programme.desc: Burl Ives earned a Best Supporting Actor Oscar for his portrayal of a family patriarch involved in a bitter land feud in this explosive western drama that also features a sumptuous musical score.

programme.title: Playing with Fire, (2019, Comedy)
programme.desc: When firefighter Jake Carson (John Cena) and his team (Keegan-Michael Key & John Leguizamo) rescue three siblings in the path of a wildfire, they realize no amount of training could have prepared them for their most challenging job yet -- babysitting.

programme.title: Panic Room, (2002, Thriller)
programme.desc: When her home is invaded by three armed robbers, a divorced woman and her young daughter hide in their specially designed panic room but end up in a deadly cat-and-mouse game anyway.

programme.title: Zodiac, (2007, Thriller)
programme.desc: Based on the Robert Graysmith books about the real life notorious Zodiac, a serial killer who terrorized San Francisco with a string of seemingly random murders during the 1960s and 1970s.

programme.title: Across the Universe, (2007, Musical)
programme.desc: A love story about a British boy and an American girl set against the backdrop of the social upheaval of the 1960s.

programme.title: Rachel Getting Married, (2008, Independent Drama)
programme.desc: When Kym, returns to the Buchman family home for the wedding of her sister Rachel, she brings a long history of personal crises, family conflict, and tragedy along with her. Rated -R

programme.title: Adaptation, (2002, Comedy)
programme.desc: Director Spike Jonze delivers a stunningly original comedy that seamlessly blends fictional characters and situations with the lives of real people. As Charlie struggles to adapt Orlean's best-selling book "The Orchid Thief".Rated: R

programme.title: Zodiac, (2007, Thriller)
programme.desc: Based on the Robert Graysmith books about the real life notorious Zodiac, a serial killer who terrorized San Francisco with a string of seemingly random murders during the 1960s and 1970s.

programme.title: The Gambler (2014)
programme.desc: A literature professor (Mark Wahlberg) with gambling debts borrows money from a mobster (Michael Kenneth Williams) and offers his life as collateral while immersing himself in an illicit, underground world.

programme.title: Boogie Nights (1997)
programme.desc: A producer (Burt Reynolds) guides a young man (Mark Wahlberg) to success in the 1970s porn industry, but greed and egotism lead to his downfall in the 80s.

programme.title: Masterminds (2016)
programme.desc: An armored-car driver (Zach Galifianakis) helps a flirty co-worker (Kristen Wiig) and her friends pull off a heist, then finds himself holding the bag after they double-cross him.

programme.title: Just Friends (2005)
programme.desc: A music executive (Ryan Reynolds) tries to woo his high-school crush (Amy Smart) while keeping his suspicious ex-girlfriend (Anna Faris) at bay.

programme.title: Cold Mountain (2003)
programme.desc: During the Civil War, a wounded Confederate soldier (Jude Law) abandons his duties to make his way home to his sweetheart (Nicole Kidman).

programme.title: Dog Day Afternoon (1975)
programme.desc: A man robs a bank to pay for his lovers operation. It turns into a hostage situation and a media circus.

programme.title: American Psycho 2 (2002)
programme.desc: Obsessed with serial killers, a college student (Mila Kunis) resorts to murder in order to become a professors teaching assistant.

programme.title: Before Dawn (2024)
programme.desc: A young man joins his countrymen on the Western front of World War I, hoping to expedite an end to the bloody conflict. However, as the battle rages on, hes forced to grapple with the brutal realities of trench warfare.

programme.title: Changing Lanes (2002)
programme.desc: An attorney (Ben Affleck) and a recovering alcoholic (Samuel L. Jackson) have a car accident which escalates into an ongoing feud.

programme.title: The Hunt for Red October (1990)
programme.desc: Moscow, Washington and a CIA analyst (Alec Baldwin) track a renegade Soviet captain (Sean Connery) and his new submarine.

programme.title: Rounders (1998)
programme.desc: The release of his debt-ridden pal (Edward Norton) from jail spurs a law student (Matt Damon) to resume high-stakes gambling.

programme.title: Enemy at the Gates (2001)
programme.desc: A Nazi sniper (Ed Harris) travels to Stalingrad to find and kill a Russian sharpshooter (Jude Law), the hero of the propaganda campaign of a political officer (Joseph Fiennes).

programme.title: Enemy at the Gates (2001)
programme.desc: A Nazi sniper (Ed Harris) travels to Stalingrad to find and kill a Russian sharpshooter (Jude Law), the hero of the propaganda campaign of a political officer (Joseph Fiennes).

programme.title: Patriot Games (1992)
programme.desc: An IRA terrorist (Sean Bean) vows revenge against the ex-CIA agent (Harrison Ford) who killed the mans brother and thwarted an attack on royalty.

programme.title: Jack Reacher (2012)
programme.desc: A defense attorney hires an enigmatic ex-Army investigator to tackle the case of a highly trained sniper who apparently murdered five people at random.

programme.title: Frank Millers Sin City (2005)
programme.desc: Lawmen, prostitutes (Devon Aoki, Alexis Bledel), a hulking thug and other sordid characters run amok in a crime-ridden metropolis.

programme.title: The Collector (2009)
programme.desc: A desperate man plans to break into his wealthy employers house, then learns that another thief has beaten him to it and rigged the place with deadly traps.

programme.title: The Autopsy of Jane Doe (2016)
programme.desc: When father and son coroners investigate the death of a beautiful "Jane Doe," they find increasingly bizarre clues.

programme.title: The Mist (2007)
programme.desc: Trapped townspeople (Thomas Jane, Marcia Gay Harden, Laurie Holden) face monsters inside and out after a supernatural fog engulfs their Maine community.

programme.title: Eagle Eye (2008)
programme.desc: Two strangers (Shia LaBeouf, Michelle Monaghan) become pawns of a mysterious woman who threatens their friends and family and uses technology to control their actions.

programme.title: Road to Perdition (2002)
programme.desc: Accompanied by his eldest son, a Depression-era mob enforcer (Tom Hanks) seeks revenge after the rest of his family are murdered by his employers (Paul Newman) jealous son.

programme.title: The Gambler (2014)
programme.desc: A literature professor (Mark Wahlberg) with gambling debts borrows money from a mobster (Michael Kenneth Williams) and offers his life as collateral while immersing himself in an illicit, underground world.

programme.title: Hostage (2005)
programme.desc: A former hostage negotiator (Bruce Willis) must take action when three carjackers hold a wealthy man (Kevin Pollak) and his children at gunpoint.

programme.title: First Blood (1982)
programme.desc: Green Beret veteran Rambo (Sylvester Stallone) takes on a Pacific Northwest sheriff (Brian Dennehy) and the National Guard.

programme.title: Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade (1989)
programme.sub-title: Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade (1989)
programme.desc: Archaeologist Jones (Harrison Ford) rescues his kidnapped father (Sean Connery), and the two race the Nazis to find the Holy Grail.

programme.title: 3:10 to Yuma (2007)
programme.desc: A rancher (Christian Bale) and the captive outlaw (Russell Crowe) in his charge learn to respect each other on a dangerous journey to catch a train.

programme.title: Red (2010)
programme.desc: Retired CIA agents (Bruce Willis, Morgan Freeman, John Malkovich) reassemble for survival after the agency sends assassins to silence them and the secrets they carry.

programme.title: The Nice Guys (2016)
programme.desc: A down-on-his-luck private eye (Ryan Gosling) works with a hired enforcer (Russell Crowe) to investigate the disappearance of a young woman (Margaret Qualley) in 1977 Los Angeles.

programme.title: Tigerland (2000)
programme.desc: A recruit (Colin Farrell) tries to get discharged from infantry training for Vietnam at Fort Lake, La., in 1971.

programme.title: Pele: Birth of a Legend (2016)
programme.desc: Under guidance from manager Vicente Feola (Vincent DOnofrio), young Pele (Kevin de Paula) utilizes his street soccer skills to lead Brazil to the World Cup in 1958.

programme.title: On the Edge (2022)
programme.desc: A metro driver witnesses his son die and sets out to track down those who are responsible.

programme.title: What Remains (2022)
programme.desc: A small town pastor is forced to reckon with an act of forgiveness when the convict he forgave for murdering his wife returns to town five years later, while the town sheriff investigates another murder that may be related.

programme.title: The Hunt for Red October (1990)
programme.desc: Moscow, Washington and a CIA analyst (Alec Baldwin) track a renegade Soviet captain (Sean Connery) and his new submarine.

programme.title: Ida Red (2021)
programme.desc: Crime boss Ida "Red" Walker turns to her son, Wyatt, to pull off one last heist to get out of prison. However, with the FBI closing in, Wyatt must soon choose between family and freedom.

programme.title: Freedoms Path (2022)
programme.desc: When Union soldier William runs from battle, hes taken to safety by a heroic young Black man. Kitch is part of a secret community of freed slaves running a section of the Underground Railroad, but a desperate slave catcher is on their trail.

programme.title: Defiance (2008)
programme.desc: In 1941 three refugee brothers (Daniel Craig, Liev Schreiber, Jamie Bell) turn a daily struggle to survive into a personal battle to save their people from the Nazis.

programme.title: The Hunt for Red October (1990)
programme.desc: Moscow, Washington and a CIA analyst (Alec Baldwin) track a renegade Soviet captain (Sean Connery) and his new submarine.

programme.title: Good Kill (2014)
programme.desc: An Air Force drone pilot (Ethan Hawke) begins to question the ethics of dropping bombs on Afghanistan from the safety of his post in Las Vegas.

programme.title: Panama (2022)
programme.desc: A defense contractor hires an ex-marine to go to Panama to complete an arms deal. In the process, he becomes involved in the U.S. invasion of Panama.

programme.title: Mercy (2023)
programme.desc: An ex-military doctor finds herself in a fight for survival when the Irish mafia seizes control of the hospital at which she works. When her son is taken hostage, shes forced to rely on her battle-hardened past and lethal skills to save the day.

programme.title: Black Noise (2023)
programme.desc: When an elite security team is sent to a remote island to rescue a VIP, their mission takes a turn as they are confronted by masked gunmen. To keep hold of their lives, the team must act quickly to assess the situation and escape the island.

programme.title: 6 Days (2017)
programme.desc: In April 1980, gunmen storm the Iranian Embassy in London. Highly trained SAS operatives prepare a counterattack, hoping to end the hostage situation in one swift blow.

programme.title: Outlaw Posse (2024)
programme.desc: In 1908 an outlaw returns from years of hiding in Mexico to claim stolen gold hidden in the hills of Montana.

programme.title: The Score (2021)
programme.desc: Two small-time crooks drive to a secluded cafe for a big score.

programme.title: Agent Game (2022)
programme.desc: A CIA officer becomes the target of a rendition operation after being the scapegoat for the death of an interrogation subject.

programme.title: Breathe (2024)
programme.desc: Maya and her young daughter are forced to live underground when Earth is left uninhabitable due to a lack of oxygen. They soon find themselves in a fight for survival when a mysterious couple arrive and claim to know the fate of Mayas husband.

programme.title: Lions for Lambs (2007)
programme.desc: The experiences of two soldiers in Afghanistan ties together separate stories unfolding in California and Washington, D.C.

programme.title: The Four Feathers (2002)
